name: AccessibilityOptionsHelper
description:
The `AccessibilityOptionsHelper` class provides access to Minecraft's accessibility options, allowing scripts to read and modify various accessibility settings that improve gameplay for users with different needs. This includes settings for visual effects, chat display, audio narration, and control toggles.

Access this helper through `OptionsHelper.getAccessibilityOptions()` or directly via `Client.options.accessibility`.
overview:
The `AccessibilityOptionsHelper` class manages various accessibility features in Minecraft:
- **Visual settings:** Text background opacity, chat transparency, visual effects
- **Audio settings:** Narrator modes and subtitle display
- **Control settings:** Toggle functionality for sneaking and sprinting
- **Display settings:** Distortion effects, FOV effects, and visual modifications

constructors.description: Internal constructor used by OptionsHelper to create the accessibility helper instance.

methods.name: getParent
methods.description: Returns the parent OptionsHelper instance.

methods.name: getNarratorMode
methods.description: Returns the current narrator mode setting.

methods.name: setNarratorMode
methods.description: Sets the narrator mode to the specified value.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description:
The narrator mode to set. Must be one of:
- "OFF" - Disable narrator completely
- "ALL" - Narrate all game elements
- "CHAT" - Narrate only chat messages
- "SYSTEM" - Narrate only system messages

examples:
// Enable narrator for all game elements
Client.options.accessibility.setNarratorMode("ALL");

methods.name: areSubtitlesShown
methods.description: Returns whether subtitles are currently enabled.

methods.name: showSubtitles
methods.description: Sets whether subtitles should be displayed.

parameters.name: val
parameters.description: true to enable subtitles, false to disable

methods.name: getTextBackgroundOpacity
methods.description: Returns the current opacity of text backgrounds in the UI.

methods.name: setTextBackgroundOpacity
methods.description: Sets the opacity of text backgrounds in the UI.

parameters.name: val
parameters.description: The opacity value to set (0.0 = fully transparent, 1.0 = fully opaque)

methods.name: isBackgroundForChatOnly
methods.description: Returns whether text backgrounds are applied only to chat messages.
examples:
const chatOnly = Client.options.accessibility.isBackgroundForChatOnly();
Chat.log(`Background for chat only: ${chatOnly}`);

methods.name: enableBackgroundForChatOnly
methods.description: Sets whether text backgrounds should only apply to chat messages.

parameters.name: val
parameters.description: true to apply backgrounds only to chat, false for all text

examples:
// Apply backgrounds to all text elements
Client.options.accessibility.enableBackgroundForChatOnly(false);

methods.name: getChatOpacity
methods.description: Returns the current opacity level of the chat window.

methods.name: setChatOpacity
methods.description: Sets the opacity level of the chat window.

parameters.name: val
parameters.description: The opacity value to set (0.0 = fully transparent, 1.0 = fully opaque)

methods.name: getChatLineSpacing
methods.description: Returns the current line spacing in the chat window.

methods.name: setChatLineSpacing
methods.description: Sets the line spacing in the chat window.

parameters.name: val
parameters.description: The line spacing value to set

examples:
// Increase line spacing for better readability
Client.options.accessibility.setChatLineSpacing(1.5);

methods.name: getChatDelay
methods.description: Returns the current chat message display delay in seconds.

methods.name: setChatDelay
methods.description: Sets the delay for chat message display in seconds.

parameters.name: val
parameters.description: The delay in seconds to set

examples:
// Increase chat delay for slower readers
Client.options.accessibility.setChatDelay(2.0);

methods.name: isAutoJumpEnabled
methods.description: Returns whether the auto-jump feature is enabled.

methods.name: enableAutoJump
methods.description: Sets whether the auto-jump feature should be enabled.

parameters.name: val
parameters.description: true to enable auto-jump, false to disable

methods.name: isSneakTogglingEnabled
methods.description: Returns whether the toggle functionality for sneaking is enabled.

methods.name: toggleSneak
methods.description: Sets whether the toggle functionality for sneaking should be enabled.

parameters.name: val
parameters.description: true to enable sneak toggling, false to disable

methods.name: isSprintTogglingEnabled
methods.description: Returns whether the toggle functionality for sprinting is enabled.

methods.name: toggleSprint
methods.description: Sets whether the toggle functionality for sprinting should be enabled.

parameters.name: val
parameters.description: true to enable sprint toggling, false to disable

methods.name: getDistortionEffect
methods.description: Returns the current distortion effect scale.

methods.name: setDistortionEffect
methods.description: Sets the distortion effect scale for nausea and other distortion effects.

parameters.name: val
parameters.description: The distortion effect scale to set (0.0 = no distortion, 1.0 = normal)

examples:
// Reduce distortion effects for motion sensitivity
Client.options.accessibility.setDistortionEffect(0.5);

methods.name: getFovEffect
methods.description: Returns the current field of view (FOV) effect scale.

methods.name: setFovEffect
methods.description: Sets the field of view (FOV) effect scale for speed-based FOV changes.

parameters.name: val
parameters.description: The FOV effect scale to set (0.0 = no FOV changes, 1.0 = normal)

examples:
// Reduce FOV effects for motion sickness prevention
Client.options.accessibility.setFovEffect(0.5);

methods.name: isMonochromeLogoEnabled
methods.description: Returns whether the monochrome logo is enabled.

methods.name: enableMonochromeLogo
methods.description: Sets whether the monochrome logo should be enabled.

parameters.name: val
parameters.description: true to enable monochrome logo, false for normal logo

examples:
// Enable monochrome logo for reduced visual stimulation
Client.options.accessibility.enableMonochromeLogo(true);

methods.name: areLightningFlashesHidden
methods.description: Returns whether lightning flashes are hidden.
